abstract: Wells Fargo and JPMorgan were allowed to gobble up small and weak competitors in the mortgage business, and now their biggest threats, Citigroup and Bank of America, are pulling out.
snippet: Wells Fargo and JPMorgan were allowed to gobble up small and weak competitors in the mortgage business, and now their biggest threats, Citigroup and Bank of America, are pulling out.
lead_paragraph: Mortgage rates are so low that it may seem like a great time to get a mortgage. For banks, however, it probably is the greatest time ever.

headline.main: After Bailout, Giants Dominate the Mortgage Business
headline.print_headline: The Trade: After Bailout, Giants Dominate the Mortgage Business

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

abstract: JPMorgan Chase is suing Javier Martin-Artajo, the manager who directly supervised Bruno Iksil, the so-called London Whale whose outsize positions prompted the bank’s multibillion-dollar trading loss.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase is suing Javier Martin-Artajo, the manager who directly supervised Bruno Iksil, the so-called London Whale whose outsize positions prompted the bank’s multibillion-dollar trading loss.
lead_paragraph: The fallout continues from a multibillion-dollar trading loss at JPMorgan Chase.

headline.main: JPMorgan Sues Boss of ‘London Whale’ in Trading Loss
headline.print_headline: JPMorgan Sues Boss of ‘London Whale’ in Trading Loss
